oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: This... Our Land: Get On Board - 1948-01-05 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM broadcast presented by the Freedom Theater of Get On Board (part 2), the first in a 13 part series titled This Our Land. Personnel for the program includes Saul Carson (writer, music/lyrics), Jack Stapp (producer, director), Tom Stewart (assistant producer, assistant director), Beasley Smith (musical director), Hy Zaret (music/lyrics), Louis Singer (music/lyrics), Bill McElhiney (music/lyrics), Carl Sandburg (music/lyrics), Lionel Ricau (announcer), Snooky Lanson (host, performer), Bradley Kincaid (host, performer, music/lyrics), Roy Acuff (performer), Eddy Arnold (performer), Fisk University Choir (performer), John F. Ohl (Fisk University Choir director), WSM Chorus (performer), Lewis Nicholas (WSM Chorus conductor). Part 3: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/471
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Fisk University Choir; Bradley Kincaid; Roy Acuff; Eddy Arnold
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Keep Me From Sinking Down (Fisk University Choir) [continued from part 1] -- Snooky Lanson and Bradley Kincaid talk -- Jim Fisk (arrangement) (Bradley Kincaid) -- Snooky Lanson and Bradley Kincaid talk -- Off To The Land Where Questions Grow [title unconfirmed] (Bradley Kincaid) -- Sally Gooden (Roy Acuff calls) -- Roy Acuff and Eddy Arnold talk -- Eddy Arnold and Snooky Lanson talk -- Traveling Broadens One (Eddy Arnold) -- I've Got A Church, You've Got A Church (Roy Acuff, Eddy Arnold, Bradley Kincaid, Snooky Lanson)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); This our land -- Get on board (Radio program); Freedom Train; American Heritage Foundation; Carson, Saul; Stapp, Jack, 1912-1980; Smith, Beasley; Zaret, Hy; Singer, Louis C., 1912-1966; McElhiney, Bill; Sandburg, Carl, 1878-1967; Ricau, Lionel; Lanson, Snooky; Kincaid, Bradley; Acuff, Roy; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Fisk University. Choir; Ohl, John F.; WSM Chorus
